intro: Pinus brutia subsp. pityusa, commonly known as the Pityusa pine, is a subspecies native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It is a medium-sized evergreen conifer characterized by its slender, upward-curving needles and clustered cones. The needles are typically 5 to 8 cm long and have a bluish-green hue, while the bark is thin and reddish-brown. This species thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
